review: Update: The Wi-Fi connectivity now seems to be working great. Perhaps there was an update at some point. For the price, it is a great device. I like the user interface of my Roku3 much better. The amazon Fire TV stick puts Amazon's services front and center on the home screen, and it is a slight hassle to get to the other services (Netflix, Hulu, HBO Go, etc.) The Roku3 interface makes it a little easier to find what you are looking for.Original review: I am having the same problem that some other reviewers have noted. It keeps dropping Wi-Fi with my router about 30 feet away. I have a Roku3 in the same place and it gets a consistent signal. Perhaps with a longer HDMI extender I could put the stick in front of my TV and that might work. The extender cable that comes with the Fire Stick is only ~5 inches long. Otherwise it seems to be an amazing amount of functionality for the price. I am disappointed that I will not be able to use it. I will play with it a little more to see if I can get it to work.

I bought another at the $25 price to put on one of our other TV's.
